com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a {P} Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
If you have only 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.
If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 120 damage for each Energy card you find there. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
During your next turn, if the Defending Pokémon is damaged by an attack, it will be Knocked Out.
This attack does 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.
This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has Alolan in its name.
Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
If 1 of your Pokémon used Bubble during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

Your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.
You may do 40 more damage. If you do, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.
Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it.
Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

Both players shuffle their Prize cards into their decks. Then, each player puts the top 3 cards of their deck face down as their Prize cards. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
If this Pokémon has any {D} Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a {F} Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Your opponent reveals their hand. You may discard a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.
This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
If any of your {P} Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Discard all basic {P} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

You can use this attack only if the total of both players’ remaining Prize cards is 6 or less. Put 6 damage counters on each of your opponent’s Pokémon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
If you have used your GX attack, this attack does 60 more damage.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
If your opponent has an Ultra Beast in play, this attack does 30 more damage.
Attach 2 {F} Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

This card provides {C} Energy.\n\nWhile this card is attached to an Ultra Beast, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card provides {C} Energy. \n\nWhile this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides {F}, {D}, and {Y} Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

You can use this Ability only if you go second. Once during your first turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Spewpa and a Vivillon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a {G} Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.
Damage from this Pokémon's attacks isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.
Put 6 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.
If this Pokémon has any {W} Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Whenever you attach a {W} Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, heal 20 damage from it.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a {W} Energy card from your hand. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a {L} Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your {F} Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a {P} Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon’s attacks.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
If you have Azelf in play, your opponent’s Pokémon in play have no Resistance.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon's attacks cost {C} more.

As long as you don't have more Pokémon in play than your opponent, this Pokémon’s attacks do 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance), and it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, put an Item card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

You can play this card only if your opponent has exactly 3 or 4 Prize cards remaining.\n\nSearch your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Then, shuffle your deck.
You can play this card only if there is any Stadium card in play.\n\nDiscard that Stadium card. During this turn, your Zygarde-GX can use its GX attack even if you have used your GX attack.
Discard 2 {W} Energy cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You can play this card only if 1 of your {Y} Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.\n\nPut 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Move a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.
Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

Choose 1:

•Search your deck for an Unidentified Fossil card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
•Put an Unidentified Fossil card from your discard pile into your hand.
Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.
Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Pokémon Tool cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no effect.
For each of your {R} Pokémon in play, put a card from your opponent’s discard pile in the Lost Zone.
The {M} Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent’s attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance) and has no Weakness.
Discard a card from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a {P} or {N} Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Discard up to 2 Ultra Beast cards from your hand. Draw 3 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
Once during each player’s turn, that player may search their deck for an Ultra Beast card, reveal it, put it into their hand, and shuffle their deck.
Play this card as if it were a 60-HP {C} Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.\n\nThis card can't retreat.

product.sm6.booster.6card.name: Sun & Moon—Forbidden Light
product.sm6.pcd.tropicaltakedown.name: Tropical Takedown
product.sm6.pcd.tropicaltakedown.sell-te: Alolan Exeggutor leads the way with its Tropical Shake attack, and lots of Alolan Pokémon come along to win as a team! This deck helps you make the most of your big attacks—go shake it up with the Tropical Takedown theme deck!
product.sm6.pcd.twilightrogue.name: Twilight Rogue
product.sm6.pcd.twilightrogue.sell-text: Outnumbered? No problem! Lycanroc does more damage when your opponent's Bench is full, so use Dusknoir to force your opponent to play more Basic Pokémon. Salazzle and Malamar pull more cards and more Energy—for more ways to win with the Twilight Rogue theme deck!
sleeve.sm6.etb.ultranecrozma.name: Elite Trainer Ultra Necrozma Card Sleeves
